Biomedical Relevance: YES - This repository is directly focused on Alzheimer's Disease research using ADNI (Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative) data to perform rare variant burden testing for genetic analysis of neurodegeneration.
Code Summary: This code implements a comprehensive gene burden analysis pipeline for Alzheimer's Disease using the REGENIE framework to test rare genetic variants. The analysis follows a two-step approach: first fitting null models with common variants and principal components, then performing gene-based burden tests on rare variants across different functional annotation masks (loss-of-function, missense, combined coding variants).
Data Types: Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) genetic data, ADNI clinical/phenotype data, genomic variants with functional annotations
Tooling: REGENIE, PLINK, ANNOVAR, Conda, Ensembl database, SKAT-O, UK Biobank/DNAnexus protocols

Code Summary: This repository contains code for processing and analyzing brain MRI data from the ADNI dataset. The main component is a multi-modal WGAN-GP (Wasserstein Generative Adversarial Network with Gradient Penalty) that jointly generates 3D brain volumes and their corresponding clinical metadata vectors. The codebase also includes preprocessing utilities for skull stripping, image centering/zooming, and data preparation.
Data Types: - 3D brain MRI volumes (NIfTI format) - Clinical metadata vectors - ADNI neuroimaging data
Tooling: - Python libraries: nibabel, numpy, pandas, torch (PyTorch), nilearn, scipy - Deep learning: PyTorch neural networks (torch.nn, torch.nn.functional) - Medical imaging: NiBabel for NIfTI file handling, nilearn for image processing - Data processing: NumPy, Pandas, SciPy - System utilities: subprocess, logging, os - Skull stripping tools (referenced in skullstrip.py)
